lines.text: Be gone, pests, and give me the bird.
We'd love to, really, but the Fox censors won't allow it.
Wait a minute. You expect us poor, innocent children to climb up dangerous scaffolding and paint naked people all over a church?
We'll do it.
But we're not doing it for art. We're not doing it for the sake of money. No! We're doing it because we love painting naked people.
Pinky, are you pondering what I'm pondering?
I think so Brain, but if Jimmy cracks corn and nobody cares, why does he keep doing it?
And now prepare to suffer indescribable torment.
Another Bob Hope special?
[upon entering the underworld]
[in a trance/flatly]
all is strange and vague...

[tranced/flatly]
Are we dead?

[tranced/flatly]
Or is this Ohio...
Promise me something, Pinky. Never breed.
[Yakko's just sung a song listing eight of the nine planets of the solar system]
There you go, that's our solar system.
You forgot Uranus.

[blowing a kiss to the audience]
Good NIGHT, everybody.
[the Warners are singing a Christmas song]

[singing]
The stockings were hung so our names clearly showed

[singing]
In the hopes that old Santa would leave a big load.

[blows a kiss to the audience]
Good NIGHT, everybody.
Beyond these doors is an agony worse than all others. You will remain in here for eternity listening to... whiny protest songs from the Sixties.

Roses are red, violets are blue / That's what they say, but it just isn't true / Roses are red, and apples are, too / But violets are violet, violets aren't blue / An orange is orange, but Greenland's not green / A pinky's not pink, so what does it mean? / To call something blue when it's not, we defile it / But what the heck, it's hard to rhyme violet.
We'd love to stay here and count our brain cells as they die one-by-one.
But we can't.

Welcome to Air Pacific, the Jolly Airline. Our deluxe 757 is equipped with a number of safety features to use in case of an emergency, such as our fuel tanks explode, and we crash like a fiery ball into the sea. You'll find life jackets under your seats. In the event of a water landing, they will keep you afloat, unless you are seized by a giant squid, and dragged screaming beneath the waves. Thank you for choosing Air Pacific. You have well over a forty percent chance of landing safely. Enjoy your flight.
Yakko, can you conjugate?
Who? Me? I've never even kissed a girl!
No, it's very simple. I'll conjugate with you.
Good night, everybody!
Skippy. You shoulda been asleep hours ago.
I know, Aunt Slappy, but I can't sleep. I keep hearing Santa's sleigh.
Ehhhh, that's just the LAPD choppers.
[Dot has just forgotten her line after about twenty tries and lets out a stream of obscenities]
That was my cute little sister who said that.
Little Miss Muffet. Little Miss Muffet sat on her tuffet / And boy what a big tuffet she had! If you're feeling insecure, just sit next to her / And then you won't feel quite so bad. Thank you.
Dot, what can you tell me about the scientists of the 1800's?
They're all dead.
No, no, no.
Ok, they're all living?
No, no, no!
Well, now we're getting into philosophy.
Pinky! Are you pondering what I'm pondering?
I think so Brain but how will we get the Spice Girls into the paella?
Nice decorating. Let me guess, Satan?
Don't look down. You might fall and hit your head and die and your brains would leak out alllllll over.
It must be inordinately taxing to be such a boob.
I'd say puberty was inordinately kind to you.
Well, helloooooo Nurse!
I am Ludwig Van Beethoven, world famous composer and pianist.
You're a what?
A pianist.

[blows a kiss]
Goodnight, everybody!
But that is what I am. A pianist.
I think we've heard enough out of you.
We protest you calling us "little kids". We prefer to be called "vertically-impaired pre-adults".
Why are you acting like this?
We're not acting. We really are like this.
Mary had a little lamb / With mint jelly. Thank you.
Where are you kids going?
Jan Murray's house?
You kids are going to be in my movie.
Movie?
Who were you talking to?
The people watching us on TV.
Peoples? What peoples?
[peering really close to the camera]
HELLO, NICE PEOPLE IN THE TV!
Do you know who I am?
Why? Did you forget?
Alas, poor Yorik!

[translating]
Woah! Check out Skull Head.
A fellow of infinite jest, of most excellent fancy.

[translating]
He was funny.
He hath borne me on his back a thousand times.

[translating]
He gave me piggy back rides.
And now, how abhorred in my imagination it is! My gorge rises at it.

[translating]
I'm going to blow chunks.

[kisses Skull Head]
Here hung those lips that I have kissed I know not how oft.

[translating]
We kissed a lot. NOT!
Where be your gibes now? Your gamboles? Your songs? Your flashes of merriment that were wont to set the table on a roar?

[translating]
How come you're not funny now?
Not one now to mock your own grinning? Quite chap-fallen?

[translating]
No one's laughing now and by the way your lower jaw's missing
Now get you to my lady's chamber, and tell her, let her paint an inch thick, to this favor she must come; make her laugh at that.

[translating]
Follow that woman and tell her no matter how much make up she wears, she's still going to croak and end up looking just like you, and see if she laughs.
Prithee, Horatio, tell me one thing.
What'd you find in the hole?
Our next cartoon.
Early to rise and early to bed/Makes a man healthy, but socially dead.
King Yakko, your throne.
The throne? How do you lift the lid?
Since when do *you* lift the lid?
Hey, mister, what's this?
A vomit bag.
Ah, poo. I got gypped. There's none in here.
All we know is that we like you. We have no taste, but we like you.
So what are we going to get Dr. Scratchy?
Ooooooh, how about an outfit from Oedipus Rex Men's Wear?
Nah, his mom would hate those.
Do you think Scratchy'd like some cologne?
We have Obsession, Repression, and Ecstacy.
Do you have anything for beginners?
Dot, would you care to give it a try? But, I'd like you to make a little curtsey.
Thanks, but I did before I left home.
If you can't say something nice, you're probably at the Ice Capades.
This is it, Pinky-O, our moment of truth. Are you pondering what I'm pondering?
Um, I think so, Brain-2, but a show about two talking lab mice? Huh, it'll never get on the air.
Whatcha doin' over there, Brain?
Contemplating your afterlife, Pinky.
Look, have I ever lied to you before?
You said keno is legal in Burbank.
If I were a better person, I'd ignore her and go on with my life. But I'm not.
Dear Santa, I have been ever so good this year. I would like a new mallet and a shiny brass anvil.
The studio of Mos Eisner... You'll never find a more wretched hive of scum and villainy. So be careful, we're going in without an agent.

[singing]
We're from Sal Monella's coffee shop/Eat our food and you're bound to drop/Then the only thing that's left to do/Head to the potty and spew spew spew!/Sal Monella's!
[repeated lines]
What are we going to do tonight brain?
try to take over the world!
Did you know that there's "P.P." on your smock?
Disgusting!
Find your seats!

[showing his butt]
Got my seat.

[showing his butt]
Got mine.

[showing her butt]
Here's mine.

[to Miss Flamiel]
Bet you don't have trouble finding yours.

[Showing Dot how to make a curtsey]
Make a little curtsey. A CURTSEY!

[Yakko and Wakko laughing and imitating Dr Scratchensniff]
Make a little curtsey. A CURTSEY.
Stop with the fun at me.
Then please stop being so funny.

[singing The Imagine Song]
I is for Imagine, M is for Me, A is for the letter A , G is for G. I is for Imagine, N is for Nice. E is for Egad, I said imagine twice!

[sarcastically]
Wow, great song.
Thanks. Let's hug!
Uh, why don't you just imagine that too?
I think so, Brain, but isn't Regis Philbin already married?
I think so Brain, but I can't memorize a whole opera in Yiddish!
Is this you? Are you happily engrossed in inconsequential cartoon trivia to the point that your socks can probably stand up by themselves?
Remember kids, Yakko spelled backwards is Okkay!
I am not devoid of humor.

[singing to La Macarena]
Dot is a nut, so we call her Macademia / She's touched in the head and kooky in the brain-ia / All the lines in this song sound pretty much the same-ia / Oy, Macademia!

[whenever he catches an innuendo]
Good Night Everybody!
I think we deserve a spanking, right on our fanny.
Hoyl! How'd you... with the going... you were there... but here now... you are... for me to see... how'd you do...
You understand any of that?
"Hoyl! How'd you... with the going... you were there... but here now... you are... for me to see... how'd you do...
Thanks for clearing that up.
Shhh. Shhh. Do you know what that means?
You got a slow leak?
Um, it's not that we wouldn't like to take your survey...
It's more like we'd rather have dental surgery.
Pinky, are you pondering what I'm pondering?
I think so, Brain, but where are we gonna find a tattoo parlor that's open at this time of night?
Tactless, yet rude.
Well. I never.
Well, you should, it's fun.
In most cases, revenge is not a good thing. In other cases, it's the only thing.
We meet again, Princess.
That's Princess Angelina Contessa Louisa Francesca Banana Fanna Lay Onna Pile Of Origami the Third. But you can call me Dot.
How come I always get the booby prize?
I'm not touching that one!

[singing]
Yakko is a yakker, Wakko is a snacker, Dot's plain cute, so's this boot.

[after Wakko eats his paperweight]
Give me back my paperweight!
Okay, but you'll have to wait a while.

[very loudly]
ALL RIGHT! IN THIS SCENE...
Oy! Too loud! Make with the whisper! Don't with the loud-maker-talk!

The poem that I wrote. This is the poem that I wrote. These are the words that are in the poem that I wrote. This is the mouth that's saying the words that are in the poem that I wrote. This is the person who has the mouth that's saying the words that are in the poem that I wrote. This is the audience that would do anything to shut up the person who has the mouth that's saying the words that are in poem that I wrote. This is the TV show that tortures the audience until they would do anything to shut up the person that has the mouth that's saying the words that are in the poem that I wrote. This...
But let this be a lesson to all. For wherever there is belching...
We'll be there!
Wherever there is stupidity...
We'll be there!
Wherever there is candy...
We'll be there a lot quicker.
Be afraid. Be very afraid.
My name's Runt, but my master calls me Stupid. What a nice guy.

[reciting "A Midsummer Night's Dream"]
For I am an honest Puck...

[translating]
I'm not touching that one!
I'm going to hurt my brother badly.
Don't worry, siblings. We'll sell that nice man a box of cookies, or die trying. Or try dying. Or do some tie-dyeing.
Stop playing with my bust.
Pinky, are you pondering what I'm pondering?
I think so, Brain, but burlap chafes me so.
Stop peeping!
Peep! Peep! Peep! Peep! Peep! Peep!
Jack Sprat could eat no fat, so he became macrobiotic and an enormous pain in the neck.
How's it going, Scratchy?
I take umbrage at that.
Oh, sure! Take all the umbrage. Don't leave any for us.
Call me "Dottie", and you die!
I'm not wearing any pants!
You... you... you...
No, THIS is a ewe; we're just plain old us.
Boys. Go fig.
Oh, oh, my heart aches with the sorrow of a thousand scouts. No merit badge. I mourn my loss.
Say, those acting classes are really paying off.
Wait. You're forgetting something.
What?
Well, being an evil villain, you are contractually required to explain your plan before you get rid of us.
Call it a hunch, sibs, but I think we've been abducted by aliens.
Aliens? What'll we do?
Go find the cafeteria?
Yeah.
You'll never live to regret it.
The workings of your mind are a mystery to me.
Pinky are you thinking what I'm thinking?
I think so Brain but where are we going to find rubber pants our size?
It proved that radio was a powerful tool. And now, Pinky, the advance of technology has brought us an even more powerful tool. Do you know what that is?
Ummm... the rubber band?
Hmmm... let me think...
Don't hurt yourself, Pinky.
Pinky, are you pondering what I'm pondering?
I think so, Brain, but if we didn't have ears we'd look like weasels.
Pinky, are you pondering what I'm pondering?
I think so, Brain, but where are we going to find a duck and a garden hose at this time of night?

[shouts]
No way! I'm the only one who's supposed to be cute on this show!
I never get to get it.
Do you realize what we will do with this pollen, Pinky?
Ummm... open a boutique?
Yes, that's it. We'll open a boutique and sell ladies' clothing and pollen.
I'm gonna make you some brain food. That's right, I'm gonna make you my famous walnut fig dough surprise.
What's the surprise?
I'm outta walnuts.
I want a pet who'll come when I call and cuddle me when I've had a bad day.
Have a kid, lady.
Ich bin ein Gettysburger.
Hello, lady in a tree.
Can you pull a rabbit out of your pants?
Well, we've decided. In outer space it's okay to wear white shoes after Labor Day.
Shhh.
What, are you leaky tires?
My five-year mission is to seek out new worlds and make them cuter.
I've told you, I am not a refrigerator. I am a laboratory robot engaged in an intricate scheme of galactic domination.
Wanna see me make bubbles with my spit?
Sure do. In fact, that's the theme of our next show.
So don't miss it.
Hey! You can't eat that!
Needs salt.
OK, lady, I love you, good bye!
[closing line]
Now that's comedy!
Who's the ham on rye?
That's me!
Remember, you said that. We didn't.
I'm famished.
[Dot grabs the sandwich and bites into it]
How dare you take a bite out of my sandwich!
You want it back?
I am Howie Tern! I'm a big star! I'm a household name!
So is the Mister Tidy Bowl man. Are you related?
You know, you'd make a fortune renting your head out as a balloon.
Yes, of course! Pinky, are you pondering what I'm pondering?
I think so, Brain, but bein' Pippi Longstocking, I mean, what would the children look like?
We're the Warner brothers.
And the Warner sister.
What do you want to do tonight, Rita?
I don't know, eat you for supper?
[Rita snatches Pinky up and eats him alive]
So far, this is my favorite episode!
Narf! Oh, roomy accommodations, Rita.
Wheel of morality turn turn turn. Tell us the lesson that we should learn!
Why does Mr. Plotz want to see me?
Because you ate his conference table, Wakko.
But I was HUNGRY.
[Wakko & Scratchensniff are trapped in an elevator]
Wanna hear a knock-knock joke?
Ok.
Knock-knock.
Who's there?
Max.
Max who?
Max wants to come in an' go crazy.
See, that's not funny because it's not really a joke.
It is if you know Max.
But I DON'T know Max.
If you did you'd be laughin'.
[Swedish accent]
[terms for checkers game]
I win... Wakko goes with me. You win, you get to stay together forever. Agreed?
[dot and yakko are dazed and in a trance]
[speaking flatly]
We Accept...

[flatly also]
To accept is to Yield...
To yield is to allow on-coming traffic the right of way...
Your breath is like the breeze off a land fill...
Food particles are wedged between your teeth...
[Yakko and Dot snap out of trance and Start dancing]
When the whippoorwill/ Whippoors in the wind / The wind can whippoor back / O nice and chubby baby!
One time, OK, one time Randy Beaman's brother ate pop rocks and drank a soda and his head exploded! Ok, bye!
Egad. You astound me, Brain.
That's a simple task, Pinky.
The pleasure's been all yours, I'm sure.
Oh, not the dynamite in the cake bit again. Who'd sink so low?
If the sun is P, and gravity is H, it makes a Phhhhhh...
OK, so, one time Randy Beaman's cat ate this fish from the fish tank but the fish was a piranha, it lived inside the cat forever, and the cat became Piranha Cat. 'Kay, bye.
Wheel of Morality, turn, turn, turn, and tell us the lesson that we should learn.
Free trip to Tahiti.
Cheers.
Mr. President? Get to work.
Aliens. Go fig.
I placed this order an hour ago! Are your out of your minds?
No, but we're out of our pickles. You'll have to take coleslaw.
Nice wig you got there.
Does Cher know you're borrowing it?
Stop laughing at them.
Ok I'm sorry.
Ooo, I like her.
Oh yeah these kids think they're really cute.
I can't help it if I'm cute.
[smooch then spits and gags]
He's got gingivitis.
What kind of fool do you take me for?
Ooo ooo! I know, I know! Let me answer! Come on!
That's pretty funny coming from a kid who looks like a demented monkey.
What's death like, Wakko?
Pretty boring. I've already hummed all the songs I know.
Hey, Bobby knows this industry.
[He kicks Squit off a perch]
Hey! What'd I do?
Nothing. I just felt like whackin' something.
Pinky are you pondering what I'm pondering?
I think so Brain but why would anyone want to pierce Bronson?
One time, ok, see, one time Randy Beeman's brother ate Pop Rocks and drank a soda at the same time and his head exploded. 'Kay, bye.
Faboo!
Don't mess with an anchorman!
Make a Googie!
Now listen up, America. If you just tuned in, I've go three kids in here who think they're funnier than the great Howie Tern. You know what I say to that? burp
That's not a burp.
Oh no?
Nope. BELCH! That's a burp.
